Dialogue.NPCText:
You behold a broad-shouldered smith, his hands blackened by years of toil. His eyes shine with keen intelligence.

He bows, then intones in haiku:

Smoke curls in night air,
Steel sings beneath moonlit forge.
What brings you, seeker?

Option.text: I seek your legendary craft, Tetsuya.
Tell me of the sword that drinks moonlight.
Who are you, smith of haiku?
I have rare ore from Frostmere.
Tell me of your life before Hinokami.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Hammer shapes the soul.
Iron remembers all pain.
I am Tetsuya.

Nine forges I tend,
Each flame guards a secret past.
What is it you seek?

Option.text: Your sword of moonlight... is it real?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Once, in silent dusk,
Blade caught falling moon’s shimmer.
Its thirst never quenched.

Only those who solve
the riddle in winter’s heart
may hold such a blade.

Iron bends for gold,
Yet my fire bows only
To wisdom or ice.

Bring me what frost hides,
Or answer what the wind asks.
Are you prepared, child?

In Frostmere’s still heart,
When silence devours the dawn,
What glimmers unseen?

Answer true, and the forge opens.

Tetsuya bows deeply, lips parting in a rare smile.

Wisdom in moon’s dance.
Frost reveals what eyes cannot.
You honor the blade.

Bring me ore of frost—
or should you have it already, I shall begin your forging.

Option.text: I will return with the ore.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Tetsuya shakes his head, voice soft as snowfall.

The wind carries tales
But not all snow hides the truth.
Return—try again.

With silent reverence, Tetsuya accepts the ore.

Metal cold as sleep,
Shaped by moon and memory.
Now the blade shall wake.

Option.action: SendMessage:The sword feels cool and alive in your hands.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Tetsuya steps closer, voice softer now.

Long before the flame,
I shaped steel beneath the stars—
in lands torn by war.

Ask what you would know.

Option.text: Why do you speak only in haiku?
Have you lost anything to Minax?

Dialogue.NPCText:
On Tokuno shores,
cherry blossoms wept ash gray—
as blades met for gold.

War lords wanted swords.
I forged for peace... but found none.
Hinokami called.

Option.text: So you left to seek peace?
And yet you still forge weapons?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Words weigh more in fire.
Brevity is the hammer.
Haiku holds the truth.

So I shape my speech,
as I shape steel—with silence,
rhythm, and meaning.

Each forge, a lesson:
One for heat, one for timing,
one for loss endured.

I built nine for strength—
not for arms alone, but soul.
Few pass all their flames.

Option.text: Could I be tested by your forges?
What happens when all are passed?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Peace is tempered steel—
not the absence of the blade,
but the hand that sheaths.

Hope fades with the dusk.
Still, I forge beneath starlight—
perhaps one will shine.

Option.text: Then I’ll carry one spark for you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
The blade is not war.
It reflects the heart behind—
slayer or savior?

Tetsuya stiffens, his voice cold as iron.

Her shadow took her—
Aiko, my moonlit lantern.
She forged no hatred.

Do not speak her name,
unless your heart bears the will
to undo her work.

Option.text: I vow to resist Minax’s darkness.
Forgive me. I meant no offense.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Tetsuya exhales slowly, eyes distant.

Steel hums when struck well.
The forge, when empty, echoes.
I hear silence now.

Option.text: Then let my visit break silence.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Tetsuya nods with gravity.

The fifth forge waits cold.
Prove your strength, then your stillness.
Return with no flame.

Seek the Shrine of Ash—
burn no foe, raise no weapon.
Only then return.

Option.text: I accept this trial of restraint.

Dialogue.NPCText:
When all forges burn,
one blade shall awaken deep—
flame that does not burn.

Few have walked that path.
Will you be the one who does?
We shall see in time.

Option.text: A worthy goal for another day.
